docs.title: eencijfer
docs.text:
ETL-tool for Dutch eencijfer

  • Documentation: https://enningb.github.io/eencijfer
  • GitHub: https://github.com/enningb/eencijfer
  • PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/eencijfer/
  • Free software: MIT

docs.title: Features
docs.text: • TODO

docs.title: Credits
docs.text: This package was created with Cookiecutter and the enningb/cookiecutter-pypackage project template.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text: ::: eencijfer

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

docs.title: Update
docs.text: • Updated duckdb-version

docs.title: Fix
docs.text:
• VooropleidingKort in assets has now correct values for all items.
  • ProfielVooropleiding now has data.

docs.title: Fix
docs.text: • Column order is preserved when replacing pgn with pseudo-id.

docs.title: Fix
docs.text: • Added openpyxl as a dependency so Excel convert works out of the box.

docs.title: Add
docs.text: • Added warning for maximum number of rows when exporting to Excel.

docs.title: Fix
docs.text: • A convert of only eencijfer-file is now possible (removed dependency of eindexamencijfers).

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Added duckdb export-format
  • Added CLI options for source_dir and result_dir

docs.title: Fix
docs.text:
• Added gracefull exit when no eencijfer-file is found
  • Fixed broken import

docs.title: Add
docs.text: • Added working-dir for intermediate saves

docs.title: Update
docs.text: • Updated some column-definitions that, according to documentation should be objects, instead of int.

docs.title: Update
docs.text: • Added possibility to export to csv or excel.

docs.title: Update
docs.text: • Downgrade numpy-version so it might work on pyodide.

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text: • Code errors.

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text: • Moved code around so it is easier to find code.

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • config-file is optional, simply calling eencijfer convert in the source_dir will just work.

docs.title: Updated
docs.text: • changed definition of VAKHAVW because of update from DUO.

docs.title: Added
docs.text: • added new eencijfer 2024

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • added dependency pyarrow

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • changed the the config variablepoetry run bump-my-version bump

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • changed the way dependencies are added

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • less dependencies for package

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • changed action to publish to test.pypi

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • working pipeline
• First release on PyPI.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Contributions are welcome, and they are greatly appreciated! Every little bit helps, and credit will always be given.

You can contribute in many ways:

docs.title: Report Bugs
docs.text:
Report bugs at https://github.com/enningb/eencijfer/issues.

If you are reporting a bug, please include:

  • Your operating system name and version.
  • Any details about your local setup that might be helpful in troubleshooting.
  • Detailed steps to reproduce the bug.

docs.title: Fix Bugs
docs.text: Look through the GitHub issues for bugs. Anything tagged with "bug" and "help wanted" is open to whoever wants to implement it.

docs.title: Implement Features
docs.text: Look through the GitHub issues for features. Anything tagged with "enhancement" and "help wanted" is open to whoever wants to implement it.

docs.title: Write Documentation
docs.text: eencijfer could always use more documentation, whether as part of the official eencijfer docs, in docstrings, or even on the web in blog posts, articles, and such.

docs.title: Submit Feedback
docs.text:
The best way to send feedback is to file an issue at https://github.com/enningb/eencijfer/issues.

If you are proposing a feature:

  • Explain in detail how it would work.
  • Keep the scope as narrow as possible, to make it easier to implement.
  • Remember that this is a volunteer-driven project, and that contributions are welcome :)

docs.title: Get Started!
docs.text:
Ready to contribute? Here's how to set up eencijfer for local development.

  1. Fork the eencijfer repo on GitHub.

  2. Clone your fork locally

    $ git clone git@github.com:your_name_here/eencijfer.git

  3. Ensure poetry is installed.

  4. Install dependencies and start your virtualenv:

    $ poetry install -E test -E doc -E dev

  5. Create a branch for local development:

    $ git checkout -b name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature

    Now you can make your changes locally.

  6. When you're done making changes, check that your changes pass the tests, including testing other Python versions, with tox:

    $ poetry run tox

  7. Commit your changes and push your branch to GitHub:

    $ git add .
$ git commit -m "Your detailed description of your changes."
$ git push origin name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature

  8. Submit a pull request through the GitHub website.

docs.title: Pull Request Guidelines
docs.text:
Before you submit a pull request, check that it meets these guidelines:

  1. The pull request should include tests.
  2. If the pull request adds functionality, the docs should be updated. Put your new functionality into a function with a docstring, and add the feature to the list in README.md.
  3. The pull request should work for Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8 and 3.9. Check https://github.com/enningb/eencijfer/actions and make sure that the tests pass for all supported Python versions.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
$ poetry run pytest tests/test_eencijfer.py

To run a subset of tests.

docs.title: Deploying
docs.text:
A reminder for the maintainers on how to deploy. Make sure all your changes are committed (including an entry in CHANGELOG.md). Then run:

$ poetry run bump2version patch # possible: major / minor / patch
$ git push
$ git push --tags

GitHub Actions will then deploy to PyPI if tests pass.

docs.title: Stable release
docs.text:
To install eencijfer, run this command in your terminal:

$ pip install eencijfer

This is the preferred method to install eencijfer, as it will always install the most recent stable release.

If you don't have pip installed, this Python installation guide can guide you through the process.

docs.title: From source
docs.text:
The source for eencijfer can be downloaded from the Github repo.

You can either clone the public repository:

$ git clone git://github.com/enningb/eencijfer

Or download the tarball:

$ curl -OJL https://github.com/enningb/eencijfer/tarball/master

Once you have a copy of the source, you can install it with:

$ pip install .

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
To use eencijfer open a console, and initialize

eencijfer init

You can get help for the different commands with:

eencijfer --help

Convert eencijfer-files to an exportformat like parquet (default) or csv:

eencijfer convert --export-format csv
